subject: Off-topic: How is ArrayIndexOutOfBounds possible?
msgSnippet: Dear Junit Users, Sorry for this off-topic message, but it is posible tah someone may be able to offer some useful advice: When I tested a program recently,  I
messageBody:
Dear Junit Users,

Sorry for this off-topic message, but it is posible tah someone may be able
to offer
some useful advice:

When I tested a program recently, I got the error:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Array index out of range: 0
at java.util.Vector.remove(Vector.java:806)
at org.multipi.ActorMailSorter.run(ActorMailSorter.java:33)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

.. it seems to be telling me that an attempt to remove element 0
of a vector, is causing a fatal error. The code which triggered this error
is:

if(!inMsgQueue.isEmpty()) {
msg = (SimpleMsg) inMsgQueue.remove(0);
...

... where inMsgQueue is a Vector. Now assuming that there are no other
Thread
processes trying to remove elements from the vector (and I believe this to
be the
case), should it be possible for this error to occur? From my understanding
of Vector
objects, this should not be possible.

TIA.

regards,

James



--
James Sinnamon sinnamon@...
